class.name: VoxelBlockyLibrary
class.brief_description: Contains a list of models that can be used by [VoxelMesherBlocky].
class.description: Provides a list of models that can be used by [VoxelMesherBlocky]. Each model corresponds to an ID in voxel data, and is generally defined from a mesh. Some extra properties can also be defined, such as how sides get culled by neighbor voxels, or how it is treated by some functionality of the voxel engine. If you create this library from code, it needs to be baked at the end using the [method bake] function. The first model (at index 0) is conventionally used for "air" or "empty".

method.name: add_model
method.description: Adds a model to the library. Returns its index, which will be the value of voxels representing it.

method.name: get_model
method.description: Gets a model from its index.

method.name: get_model_index_from_resource_name
method.description: Finds the index of the first model having the specified resource name. If not found, returns [code]null[/code].

method.name: get_voxel_index_from_name
method.description: Finds the index of the first model having the specified resource name. If not found, returns [code]null[/code].

members.member: Array of all the models. The index of each model corresponds to the value representing them in voxel data's TYPE channel.
